summary: The S&P 500 eked out a 0.1% gain on Friday, March 21, 2025, as the index snapped its weekly losing streak.

headline: Super Micro jumps after JPMorgan upgrade, lifts price target
summary: JPMorgan analysts upgrade Super Micro Computer (SMCI) to Neutral from Underweight, raising their price target to $45 per share from $35 over Nvidia's (NVDA) Blackwell chip ramp up. Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton, joined by Epistrophy Capital Research chief market strategist and The Drill Down podcast host Cory Johnson, take a closer look at the analyst note and what it siganls for Super Micro. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Boeing contract, Tesla meeting, Super Micro: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance anchor Josh Lipton examines the top stories on Wall Street as part of today's Market Minute, including US President Donald Trump awarding Boeing (BA) a US airforce fighter jet contract, Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk calling a surprise all-hands meeting, and JPMorgan upgrading Super Micro Computer (SMCI) to Neutral from Underweight. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: SMCI stock upgraded to Neutral at JPMorgan after ‘cycling past’ filing challenges
summary: Investing.com -- Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI) stock received an upgrade at JPMorgan, to Neutral from Underweight, after the AI server maker “has cycled past the uncertainty” related to SEC filings and the anticipated benefits from increased demand for Blackwell-based server shipments.
